newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Lion blames restructure for staff loss.
newsitem.headline: Lion blames restructure for staff loss.

text.p: Lion Nathan Ltd Chief Executive Douglas Myers said on Wednesday the company's ongoing restructuring was the most likely cause for the departure of several senior managers over the last year.

Myers, asked to explain the resignations of top management over the last year, said Lion had brought in a number of new people when Chief Operating Officer Kevin Roberts joined the company eight years ago.
"We are in a mature business. That is a fact of life," Myers said. "Some of those people have found the constraints of our industry such that they have sought fame and fortune elsewhere," he said.
Myers noted that many had gone to top tier enterprises after leaving Lion.

"We've also been through a protracted degree of restructuring and that is not over. When we bought Bond Breweries they were in a state of dis-equilibrium and shock," he said. Roberts and Myers decided then that leaving intact the regional structure in Australia was an appropriate move to allow
the breweries to rebuild in their local communities.
But confronting a national competitor in Fosters with a handful of regional breweries "has really proved impossible".
Under Australian Managing Director Gordon Cairns, Lion would seek to develop a more united, centralised operation in Australia.
"Inevitably, as a result of that, there have people whose careers and aspirations have been unable to be met," Myers said.

Roberts has already announced his resignation, but will remain on the board. Myers and Roberts said the departure of Roberts, who is leaving to pursue personal interests, was amicable. -- Wellington Newsroom (64-4-4734746)
